poem:
The Crack in the Story  

Rebecca, petals fallen  
from a polished rose,  
casting shadows  
on Shakespeare's stage.

In 2021, she threw  
a stone—her story split,  
crumbling the facade,  
wild petals take  
a new breath in the air.

A truth unfolds  
in the cracks,  
softly—  
the beauty  
of becoming whole.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "‘I’ve had a wild, chaotic, beautiful life’: Rebecca Hall on race, regrets and learning to be herself We all thought that we knew Rebecca Hall – English rose, on stage since childhood, daughter of the Royal Shakespeare Company’s founder Sir Peter Hall, regularly described in Hollywood as one of the best actors of her generation. But in 2021 she took what she calls now “a big swing” and suddenly the whole story cracked in half.". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
